t: You Will Not Abandon My Soul
Preserve*pn me, O God, for in you I take refuge.
I*ln say to the Lord,*s “You are my Lord; I*ld have no good apart from you.”
As*pn for the saints in the land, they are the excellent ones, in*ld whom is all my delight.
The*pn sorrows of those who run after another god shall multiply; their*ld drink offerings of blood I will not pour out or*ld take their names on my lips.
The*pn Lord*s is my chosen portion and my cup; you*ld hold my lot.
The*ln lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; indeed,*ld I have a beautiful inheritance.
I*pn bless the Lord*s who gives me counsel; in*ld the night also my heart instructs me.
I*ln have set the Lord*s always before me; because*ld he is at my right hand, I shall not be shaken.
Therefore*pn my heart is glad, and my whole being rejoices; my*ld flesh also dwells secure.
For*ln you will not abandon my soul to Sheol, or*ld let your holy one see corruption.
You*pn make known to me the path of life; in*ld your presence there is fullness of joy; at*ld your right hand are pleasures forevermore.
